The density of MgO has been taken as 3.58 g/cm 3 from the literature.
33 The surface properties of MgO were analyzed by N 2 adsorption at 77 K in a TriStar Plus II gas-volumetric apparatus (Micromeritics, Norcross, GA, USA). The specific surface area ( S BET) was calculated by fitting the experimental data points with a Brunauer–Emmett–Teller isotherm
34 and was 215 m 2/g. The pore volume ( V p) was derived from the volume of absorbed nitrogen at p/ p 0 = 0.95 and was 0.25 cm 3/g. Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) analysis has been performed on the as-prepared composites, see the Supporting Information.
